author: ForestMenOfEndor
title: Shazam polybag available with Blu-Ray
review:
This is another fine DC Universe minifigure.

The parts and printing are high quality. The source material is well represented. Shazam's grin, in particular, seems suitable.

The figure is hardly exclusive, since it just swaps the white hood from 76120: Batwing and The Riddler Heist for a relatively common wig.

For those who want to own it, you can also purchase the "Shazam: Magic and Monsters" Blu-Ray + DVD combo pack with polybag included for $18 from Amazon. I actually found it on sale for $10 a week ago, with free two-day Prime shipping. Since the polybag alone goes for $16 on BrickLink in the US, that's not a bad deal!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Wisdom of Solomon Appears.
review:
Set #30623 SHAZAM!: A Polybag included with what may very well turn out to be the last DC Animated Direct to Video Special, SHAZAM! is DC's Captain Marvel, aka Shazam, in LEGO form.

This particular version represents the character quite impressively. He features a very solid looking torso with unprinted red legs, a soft-goods white cape and a pair of vaguely familiar expressions. One side is smiling emulating Superman with a wide open grint while the other has electrical energy playing across his face and escaping from his eyes. Perhaps he's just transformed. His hair piece, I believe, is a re-use from the DCEU Superman Minifigures.

Overall Shazam is a nice offering and it's pretty great to have him with this particular version of his costume... not sure if original or New 52 actually. Strongly Recommended.
